str2: On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To become vain or foolish, be perverted. From mataios; to render foolish, i.e. wicked or, idolatrous.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From dialogizomai; discussion, i.e. consideration, or debate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To darken. From skotos; to obscure.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Unintelligent, without wisdom, unwise, undiscerning (implying probably moral defect). By implication, wicked.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
